00053 
00054 #ifndef FSM_H
00055 #define FSM_H
00056 
00057 
00058 /*****************************************************************************
00059 ************************* PUBLIC DEFINITIONS *********************************
00060 *****************************************************************************/
00061 /*
00062  * LCP Packet header = Code, id, length.
00063  */
00064 #define HEADERLEN       (sizeof (u_char) + sizeof (u_char) + sizeof (u_short))
00065 
00066 
00067 /*
00068  *  CP (LCP, IPCP, etc.) codes.
00069  */
00070 #define CONFREQ         1               /* Configuration Request */
00071 #define CONFACK         2               /* Configuration Ack */
00072 #define CONFNAK         3               /* Configuration Nak */
00073 #define CONFREJ         4               /* Configuration Reject */
00074 #define TERMREQ         5               /* Termination Request */
00075 #define TERMACK         6               /* Termination Ack */
00076 #define CODEREJ         7               /* Code Reject */
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * Link states.
00080  */
00081 #define INITIAL         0               /* Down, hasn't been opened */
00082 #define STARTING        1               /* Down, been opened */
00083 #define CLOSED          2               /* Up, hasn't been opened */
00084 #define STOPPED         3               /* Open, waiting for down event */
00085 #define CLOSING         4               /* Terminating the connection, not open */
00086 #define STOPPING        5               /* Terminating, but open */
00087 #define REQSENT         6               /* We've sent a Config Request */
00088 #define ACKRCVD         7               /* We've received a Config Ack */
00089 #define ACKSENT         8               /* We've sent a Config Ack */
00090 #define OPENED          9               /* Connection available */
00091 
00092 
00093 /*
00094  * Flags - indicate options controlling FSM operation
00095  */
00096 #define OPT_PASSIVE     1               /* Don't die if we don't get a response */
00097 #define OPT_RESTART     2               /* Treat 2nd OPEN as DOWN, UP */
00098 #define OPT_SILENT      4               /* Wait for peer to speak first */
00099 
00100 
00101 /*****************************************************************************
00102 ************************* PUBLIC DATA TYPES **********************************
00103 *****************************************************************************/
00104 /*
00105  * Each FSM is described by an fsm structure and fsm callbacks.
00106  */
00107 typedef struct fsm {
00108     int unit;                           /* Interface unit number */
00109     u_short protocol;           /* Data Link Layer Protocol field value */
00110     int state;                          /* State */
00111     int flags;                          /* Contains option bits */
00112     u_char id;                          /* Current id */
00113     u_char reqid;                       /* Current request id */
00114     u_char seen_ack;            /* Have received valid Ack/Nak/Rej to Req */
00115     int timeouttime;            /* Timeout time in milliseconds */
00116     int maxconfreqtransmits;/* Maximum Configure-Request transmissions */
00117     int retransmits;            /* Number of retransmissions left */
00118     int maxtermtransmits;       /* Maximum Terminate-Request transmissions */
00119     int nakloops;                       /* Number of nak loops since last ack */
00120     int maxnakloops;            /* Maximum number of nak loops tolerated */
00121     struct fsm_callbacks* callbacks;/* Callback routines */
00122     char* term_reason;          /* Reason for closing protocol */
00123     int term_reason_len;        /* Length of term_reason */
00124 } fsm;
00125 
00126 
00127 typedef struct fsm_callbacks {
00128     void (*resetci)                     /* Reset our Configuration Information */
00129                 (fsm*);
00130     int  (*cilen)                       /* Length of our Configuration Information */
00131                 (fsm*);
00132     void (*addci)                       /* Add our Configuration Information */
00133                 (fsm*, u_char*, int*);
00134     int  (*ackci)                       /* ACK our Configuration Information */
00135                 (fsm*, u_char*, int);
00136     int  (*nakci)                       /* NAK our Configuration Information */
00137                 (fsm*, u_char*, int);
00138     int  (*rejci)                       /* Reject our Configuration Information */
00139                 (fsm*, u_char*, int);
00140     int  (*reqci)                       /* Request peer's Configuration Information */
00141                 (fsm*, u_char*, int*, int);
00142     void (*up)                          /* Called when fsm reaches OPENED state */
00143                 (fsm*);
00144     void (*down)                        /* Called when fsm leaves OPENED state */
00145                 (fsm*);
00146     void (*starting)            /* Called when we want the lower layer */
00147                 (fsm*);
00148     void (*finished)            /* Called when we don't want the lower layer */
00149                 (fsm*);
00150     void (*protreject)          /* Called when Protocol-Reject received */
00151                 (int);
00152     void (*retransmit)          /* Retransmission is necessary */
00153                 (fsm*);
00154     int  (*extcode)                     /* Called when unknown code received */
00155                 (fsm*, int, u_char, u_char*, int);
00156     char *proto_name;           /* String name for protocol (for messages) */
00157 } fsm_callbacks;
00158 
00159 
00160 /*****************************************************************************
00161 *********************** PUBLIC DATA STRUCTURES *******************************
00162 *****************************************************************************/
00163 /*
00164  * Variables
00165  */
00166 extern int peer_mru[];          /* currently negotiated peer MRU (per unit) */
00167 
00168 
00169 /*****************************************************************************
00170 ************************** PUBLIC FUNCTIONS **********************************
00171 *****************************************************************************/
00172 
00173 /*
00174  * Prototypes
00175  */
00176 void fsm_init (fsm*);
00177 void fsm_lowerup (fsm*);
00178 void fsm_lowerdown (fsm*);
00179 void fsm_open (fsm*);
00180 void fsm_close (fsm*, char*);
00181 void fsm_input (fsm*, u_char*, int);
00182 void fsm_protreject (fsm*);
00183 void fsm_sdata (fsm*, u_char, u_char, u_char*, int);
00184 
00185 
00186 #endif /* FSM_H */
